thread.title: Schoolgirl cuts hair to raise money for children with cancer
thread.title_full: Schoolgirl cuts hair to raise money for children with cancer

author: Tabitha Wilson
title: Schoolgirl cuts hair to raise money for children with cancer
text:
Schoolgirl cuts hair to raise money for children with cancer Tabitha Wilson Thu 4 September 2025 at 4:00 am UTC 2 min read
Freya-Mae Sanderson after having her hair cut (Image: Supplied) A schoolgirl has raised more than £500 for children with cancer by cutting off her hair.
Freya-Mae Sanderson, from Boosbeck, donated her hair to the Little Princess Trust, which makes wigs for young cancer patients.
Her fundraising efforts and generous donation have been praised by her community and local MP Luke Myer.
Freya before the big chop (Image: Supplied) Mr Myer said: "Freya has shown amazing bravery and kindness.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement "Cutting off her hair and raising hundreds of pounds for such an important cause will make a real difference to children who need it most.
"She should be really proud of herself for such a generous act."
She was praised by MP Luke Myer (Image: Supplied) Freya-Mae, 13, said she was inspired to take part after seeing the impact cancer can have on families.
She said: "I have a passion for designing hair and love to create new styles.
"I spend a lot of time on my hair but decided I wanted to brave the chop and help children with cancer.
"Cancer is a terrible illness and I have lost family close to my heart.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement "I wanted to raise money and donate my hair to try and help.
"When I received my pack, it said you’re not just helping children by donating hair, you’re bringing confidence and a smile to their face and that’s what I wanted to do."
During the hair cut (Image: Supplied) Her mother, Kayleigh Sanderson, said the whole family was "incredibly proud" of her.
Mrs Sanderson said: "I'm so proud of my amazing daughter.
"For anyone who knows her, knows that Freya loves her hair.
"She spends hours designing different hairstyles on herself, her many styling heads, and relatives, hoping to pursue it as a career in the future.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement "Having her hair cut short was a huge thing for Freya to do but such an amazing, kind thing too.
"Then to raise so much money as well for an amazing charity, especially at only 13 years old."
Freya-Mae raised more than £400 in sponsorship just three days before her haircut, bringing her total to over £500.
She raised more than £500 (Image: Supplied) Mrs Sanderson said she is now collecting the donations and thanked everyone who supported her daughter.
She said anyone who still wants to donate can contact her through her shop, TreasureKins.
Freya-Mae’s fundraising follows a family tradition of community involvement and creativity.
TreasureKins, the family’s handmade gift and home fragrance business, has become a valued part of the Boosbeck community as they continue to support charitable causes and events.
